item.title: Report I-2025010054
item.description:
Report I-2025010054

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T00:57:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-30
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pax had spare lithium battery inside a pouch filled with pens and stickers. According to FA battery started to smoke and release a funky smell. Open opening they noticed that a camera battery had started expanding. Battery melt and charred some of the things that was around it. Appears one of the 3 batteries inside pouch started to smoke. It did char and melt some of the surrounding items. Was put inside BCB. After a thorough debrief with the flight attendants and the passenger involved, it appears the passenger was attempting to improvise a point-and-shopt style camera battery with wires and electrical tape to charge her iPod. Our passenger(seated in 32A) with the battery problem alerted the FA B & C after she noticed smoke and an electrical smell coming from the small fabric purse they were in. She reportedly leapt over her seat mates with the bag and brought it back to the aft galley and said something to the effect of "l have a battery fire in my bag." According to the flight attendants, the small amount of smoke and fumes that were present in the cabin quickly dissipated. 15 photos sent to FAA hazmat.

item.title: Report X-2025020264
item.description:
Report X-2025020264

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED AFTER THE BOX FELT COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED AN INNER BOX WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARK CONTAINING A SINGLE ONE GALLON (3.79L) PLASTIC JUG OF MUELLER WHIZZER CONCENTRATE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
